title: 114_hr4302
content: The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. A report must be made to Congress when this determination is reached. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, resolving outstanding obligations of the Federal Government, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. They may delegate functions as needed and no positions or functions of the Bank are authorized after 60 days of abolishment. Conforming amendments and repeals are also included in the Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including various sections from different Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including the elimination of certain positions and the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is repealed, including the elimination of the Office of Inspector General for the Bank. Amendments to the Inspector General Act of 1978 are made, with suggestions for further amendments to Federal statutes. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive orders, rules, regulations, or documents pertaining to a department or office is deemed to refer to the new department or office after functions are transferred. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duties, powers, and programs, while "office" encompasses various organizational entities.
